title: Pharmaceutical Cold Chain Delivery and Expired Medication Retrieval
desc_split: A pharmaceutical distributor must deliver life-saving medications to hospitals and clinics while simultaneously collecting expired drugs for safe disposal. Each refrigerated truck (capacity <capacity> kg) starts at the central warehouse (<loc_depot>) and must first deliver temperature-sensitive medications to healthcare facilities (<loc_customer>) before returning to pick up expired inventory. The clinics have strict time windows (<time_windows>) to ensure medications are received during operational hours, and expired pickups must occur before waste storage limits are exceeded. Additionally, each route must stay within a <distance_limit> km radius to maintain cold chain integrity and avoid overworking drivers.
label: vrpbltw

title: Same-Day Grocery Delivery and Customer Returns
desc_split: A grocery delivery service operates in a bustling city, offering same-day delivery and pickup of returned items. Customers specify precise delivery (<time_windows_open>) and pickup (<time_windows_close>) windows to align with their schedules. The service uses trucks with a <capacity> kg load limit to first deliver fresh groceries to residential areas (<loc_customer>) before returning to collect returned items. Routes must adhere to a <distance_limit> km limit to ensure timely service without overtime, and all pickups (backhaul) must occur after deliveries to prevent cargo mix-ups.
label: vrpbltw

title: Electric Vehicle Battery Swap Station Refilling and Collection
desc_split: An EV charging network relies on trucks to replenish depleted battery swap stations and retrieve used batteries for recharging. Each truck (<capacity> batteries) departs the central recharging hub (<loc_depot>), first delivering fresh batteries to stations (<loc_customer>) before collecting discharged ones. Stations have strict operational hours (<time_windows>) to avoid service disruptions, and routes must stay within a <distance_limit> km range to ensure trucks return before their own batteries drain. The challenge is balancing delivery and collection loads without exceeding vehicle capacity.
label: vrpbltw

title: Perishable Produce Harvesting and Farm Supply Delivery
desc_split: A farming cooperative coordinates trucks to collect perishable produce (e.g., strawberries, leafy greens) from farms while delivering agricultural supplies like pesticides and irrigation parts. Each truck (<capacity> kg) must first drop off supplies to farms (<loc_customer>) before collecting fragile produce, as overloading could damage crops. title: Apparel Store Inventory Replenishment and Returns Logistics
desc_split: A fashion retailers distribution center (<loc_depot>) must restock regional stores with new inventory while retrieving returned items. title: Construction Site Material Supply and Debris Collection
desc_split: A construction logistics firm must deliver building materials to active sites and collect debris for recycling. The challenge is to coordinate deliveries and pickups within tight timelines while optimizing fuel usage and adhering to strict environmental recycling quotas.
